entries.meaning: (obsolete outside dialects) A shapeless piece; a fragment.

verbs.description: mammock (third-person singular simple present mammocks, present participle mammocking, simple past and past participle mammocked)

entries.meaning: (obsolete outside dialects, chiefly North Carolina, transitive) To tear to pieces.
examples: Yet, in the meaning of presumptuous, "bold" could reveal the poet's ambivalence, since in their impudence the navvies took liberties with nature by mammocking it. Another reservation could be the implied contrast with Harry  […]
